title: We are Avant Gaming, Ask us Anything!
body:
Hey guys, 

We're Avant Gaming, currently 5th on the OPL ladder!
We're going to be answering your questions tonight from 8pm - 9pm but feel free to get in now and post them early. 

Answering questions will be: 

**Top:** Ceres (Twitter: @Cereslol)
**Jungle:** Sybol (Twitter: @syb0l)
**Middle:** Triple (Twitter: @TripleOCE)
**ADC: **Blinky 
**Support** Jayke (Twitter: @JaykeLoL)
**Coach:** Pinch (Twitter: @Pinchgg)
**House Dog:** Kobe (Twitter: @AV_Kobe)

Ask away!

replies.body: Is Blinky now deactivating his twitter during the week every week as a good luck superstition after it (obviously single-handedly) beat Legacy last week?
Haha, not at all! just helps me focus and not get distracted, the only thing holding me back is myself, and not having twitter makes me focus more and put effort into soloq.

Hi,

I am a fan of yours, but I swear when I had tipped you guys 2-0 against other teams, you lose and when I lost faith and tipped you guys 0-2 against legacy, you won.

I feel heartbroken, but it also confirms that you guys are capable to perform greatly.
Big sorry LOL thanks for the support
Sorry about that.... we kind of wish we didnt lose to abyss either, would be good for standings! but we will show in gauntlet you can count on us ^_^

Maybe with the new 7.16 patches there will be more assassin play due to control mages being balanced out. However, I still think the advantages that mages provide to the majority of competitive team compositions far outweigh that of assassins in the current meta!

Kalista coming back to meta is pretty good, because i still believe im the best kalista in OCE, i do think people will put priority if not ban it in future games if they want to shut me down to get their bot lanes ahead.
Personally for all of you, what are your favourite Maxibons?

The Monster Cookie Maxibon is perfection!

Jayke
Cookies and cream 100%

> [{quoted}](name=AV Blinky,realm=OCE,application-id=ATM3HYki,discussion-id=vBmEtHfF,comment-id=00090001,timestamp=2017-08-11T10:27:33.919+0000)
>
> Cookies and cream 100%

^ this

Blinky I have a question for you. What would you say is the major difference between a challenger adc and a low diamond adc. I feel like I play lane decently well and go even, then I don't really have a clue what to do outside of lane. Also what do you think of twitch and sivir in the current meta? Thanks :)

Hmm... a huge difference is how you use your lead to help your team win the game and not just yourself, anybody can get a lead but how do you use that lead to gain victory is lacking in a lot of low elo adcs.
Sivir and twith definitely have their spots in this meta, sivir is very good against tristana and or pushing adcs because it negates her lane push and goes even, scales well, and twitch is a good substitute for hyper scaling adcs if you need one and the other are banned, or you're just very good at twitch, both can be played well!
@Jayke - Will you kiss me on the lips?

Please refer to my summoner name sorry

Jayke
What is Kobe doing right now? üêï üêï

Being hansum
I love him

Hi,

I was wondering if one of use if you have time come help me get better at LOL and hopfully become a pro player like all of you. My main is Teemo he is a jungler so I was wondering if I could 1v1 someone and you give me points and tips.

Thank you so much
From Pro
It takes a lot of focused and goal driven solo queue.
rest in piece mate. no response for the teemo jungle main.

What do you think was the biggest factor to you guys beating Legacy last week? 

And how to you plan to continue the momentum heading into this weekends matches?
A change in structure of our practice lead to some decent results. Also they were sick on the day of the game apparently (not to take anything away from our win :D)

Our biggest contributing factor to our victory over Legacy was how we practiced leading into the game (which I obviously can't go into detail with sorry!)

Continuing into the final two weeks of the OPL and the Gauntlet, we will mainly be aiming to refine our play + keep a focus on consistency, similarly to how we played our two games against Legacy, and first game against Dire Wolves.

Jayke

Sybol, how much do you hate me. How can I earn your love and respect? When will you 1v1 me?
All members, 1v1?

Lex it's not that i hate you but I hate that I love you

Don't make a jungler do a 1v1 man its not polite
<3

@Anyone
I've learned that constantly identifying your problems and finding solutions for them is a good way to improve.
What do you guys do when you can't identify a problem or find a solution for it?
Thanks.

fortunately or unfortunately, we haven't gotten to that stage, there are always identifiable problems and i do not believe that will ever change.
all we can do is keep trying until we find a solution that works and is effective, so we just keep at it :)

Hey guys,

1) How are you all feeling after coming off a big win over Legacy on the weekend? Do you think you can continue that level of play into the gauntlet?

2) **Pinch**: Has the way you coach changed much over the course of the year? Where do you think you've improved?

3) **Kobe**: Come visit us at Riot please <3

I can only REALLY speak for myself, but as shown on the cameras after the game it was just another week for us. We all have much bigger goals in mind than beating anyone in the OPL, and we are aware that our progress as individuals and as a team is far from over despite 2-0'ing the first place team.


Jayke

Absolutely! How I coach and how I run practice changes all the time, sometimes drastically. One thing I am very willing to do as a coach is to consistently question if what we are doing is working, take feedback, and adapt our practice. This can be very stressful as I'm always being insanely critical of myself and our process', and it can lead to a really tense environment if we don't have any answers to our issues, but it shows results.

Since I'm a new coach I've improved in every single facet of this job: Game knowledge, practice systems/process', handling players outside of the game. I think the most stark difference from me 1 year ago to now would be my understanding of the best way to use scrims. I'm still looking to improve everywhere but one focal point for my own improvement at the moment is general leadership and authority.
yes ok see you tomorrow {{champion:75}} {{champion:75}}
